title: Provide correct user message and exit when synced optimistically with wrong chain
body:
<!-- 
By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with the Code of Conduct, 
including treating everyone with respect:
https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/master/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md

Not all sections will apply to all issue types.
-->

### Description

Sync optimistically for a few finalized epochs and then receive a message from EL that a block before (ancestor) latest finalized is invalid. Teku cycles with exceptions after it but is not exiting. It's not clear what's wrong. 
(logging with extra debug logging next)

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Exit with reason message

It's very unusual case btw
I'm not sure it could happen outside test

I have no idea how we managed to get into that state - normally there is an error that an invalid chain may have been finalized.  If such a case ever happened 1/3rd of validators should be slashed though so it doesn't seem like something we need to particularly polish as the network will have bigger issues if it ever occurs.
